image.altText: People board plane on tarmac

props.synopsis: Early Bonza flights in and out of the company's base on Queensland's Sunshine Coast, along with Melbourne legs to Rockhampton, Gladstone, and Tamworth, have been suspended.

title.children: Bonza 'finished' say staff as airline cancels flights across the country

image.altText: A man and a woman walk crouch on grass with a little dog, large crops growing behind them

props.synopsis: Gone are the days of leaving the key in the ignition or the house unlocked as thieves target isolated properties as easy pickings.

title.children: Judy worries when her husband checks the farm at night with a rise in rural crime changing the way they live

image.altText: Flooded house in Norman Park in Brisbane

props.synopsis: Floods, bushfires, and severe storms send insurance costs skyrocketing. It's high time for Australia to heed warnings from other parts of the world before insurance becomes unaffordable for all Australians — or simply unavailable.

title.children: All Australians will foot the bill after climate disasters leave insurance industry on the brink

image.altText: Police vehicles parked at crime scene.

props.synopsis: A 17-year-old girl will face court charged with murder after the fatal stabbing of a 10-year-old girl in a suburb of Lake Macquarie in New South Wales.

title.children: Teenage girl charged with murder of 10-year-old after stabbing at Boolaroo

image.altText: Darren Alsemgeest and Jonathan Darbro crouching examining equipment filled with mosquitoes

props.synopsis: A Queensland-developed system of trapping mosquitoes and testing their saliva for viruses, including Ross River, is being used to warn people before cases start ramping up.

title.children: Ross River virus numbers are increasing. Experts say the warning signs of an outbreak are in mosquito spit

image.altText: Upwards shot of the BHP building in Perth.

props.synopsis: BHP's offer for Anglo American last week shouldn't have come as a complete surprise. After all, the Big Australian has a long history of reinvention — and this time the mining giant is betting $60 billion on a renewable energy future.

title.children: How BHP used its $60 billion bid for Anglo American to hit back at climate change deniers

image.altText: Australian Prime Minister Anthony Albanese attends a rally to a call for action to end violence against women.

props.synopsis: A national register for offenders, electronic monitoring and national coordination of intelligence on serial violent offenders could be on the agenda at a meeting of state leaders at the national cabinet tomorrow to discuss violence against women.

title.children: National register for violent offenders, electronic monitoring — what is on the table for national cabinet

image.altText: closup of woman on seafront promenade.

props.synopsis: First Nations activist Murrawah Johnson wins the 2024 Goldman Environmental Prize after blocking a proposed coal mine on the basis of cultural erosion and human rights breaches.

title.children: Activist goes from gatecrashing small-town parades to historic Land Court victory and prestigious award

image.altText: Bakery goods on bench, croissants very visible with prices next to them

props.synopsis: At a popular bakery which has become widely shared on social media, a business owner has asked customers to not include staff faces when taking photos or videos.

title.children: 'You look up and the camera is in your face': This bakery wants you to stop filming its staff

image.altText: A screenshot from the GiveSendGo page, reading 'the leader in freedom fundraising'

props.synopsis: A government inquiry into right-wing extremism in Australia has revealed plans for a "whites-only" rural community in Victoria, and how combat clubs centred on brotherhood and self defence could be a front for neo-Nazi recruiters.

title.children: Crowdfunding website defends hosting 'whites-only' farming community fundraiser

image.altText: A composite of three images, of a young girl in a school uniform, clinging to school gates or lying on steps.

props.synopsis: There's no easy solution, and every kid's situation is different, but here are some resources that might help struggling families.

title.children: Your child says they just can't go to school. These are your options

image.altText: a weather map showing rain across the state, particularly along the east coast

props.synopsis: Thanks to a stalled high-pressure system, known as a "blocking high", rain — and potentially flooding — could be on the cards for New South Wales.

title.children: How a split in the jet stream could bring a 10-day soaking to NSW

image.altText: A man sits at a wooden desk typing on a laptop in a room with one bare brick wall and a large light-filled window.

props.synopsis: These financial experts say you can invest in the planet and make money along the way. It's why a growing number of Australians are choosing to invest ethically.

title.children: Can you invest ethically and still make a stack of money? These experts say yes

image.altText: A close up of a hand holding a mobile phone, which is displaying an apology to customers written on the Optus website.

props.synopsis: Telcos will be forced to share real-time network information during outages and set up a body to take charge of Australia's triple-0 system, in the wake of last year's Optus outage.

title.children: The government ordered an investigation into last year's Optus outage. Now its findings are in

image.altText: A young woman sits in the dark on the couch, looking at her phone.

props.synopsis: Young people and women are particularly at risk, with work and personal emails or phones most commonly used by perpetrators.

title.children: One in seven people admit to using tech to sexually harass colleagues at work, new data shows

image.altText: A man's clenched fist in front of a blurred woman's face

props.synopsis: New data shows almost half the women who were victims of a homicide in the last financial year were killed by a former or current intimate partner. While this represents a 28 per cent increase on the previous year, it is also the second-lowest rate since records began in 1990.

title.children: Rate of intimate partner homicide involving female victims rose 28pc last financial year

image.altText: Sarah Wilson turns away in tears as Anthony Albanese addresses a rally outside parliament house

props.synopsis: It was meant to be a moment in which Anthony Albanese joined with tens of thousands of people nationally to demand an end to men's violence. The result was an organiser in tears, accusations of lying and the prime minister making a hasty exit.

title.children: An organiser in tears, accusations of lying and a PM in a hurried exit

image.altText: A woman smiles in front of a bush in front of a home with a black roof

props.synopsis: An experiment finds dark-roofed homes in Western Sydney are recording roof cavity temperatures as much as 10 degrees warmer than homes with lighter shades.

title.children: Why Deborah still has roof temperatures around 50 degrees, despite spending thousands on cooling

image.altText: A man in a blue suit and tie stands at a podium.

props.synopsis: Premier Steven Miles insists the new reporting model will ensure Queenslanders have access to "more data than ever before", but the state opposition is vowing to reverse the changes if elected.

title.children: Queensland public sector workforce data to be released once a year after government scraps biannual reports

image.altText: Herd of cows in grassy field.

props.synopsis: The remaining slice of a 200-year-old farming property in Tasmania's north-west is up for sale, after years mired in controversy, unrealised grand ambitions, allegations of animal cruelty and mismanagement, and the recent loss of a major milk contract.

title.children: Milk dream sours for Chinese company as iconic Tasmanian farm put up for sale

image.altText: A concrete house lies in ruin

props.synopsis: The United States and United Kingdom both say Hamas should accept the latest deal from Israel, as mediators meet for another round of talks in the Middle East.

title.children: Western allies urge Hamas to 'take that deal' as Israel proposes ceasefire

image.altText: A young girl with brown eyes looks over her shoulder as she smiles.

props.synopsis: Since the war began in Gaza, children have been unable to go to school and have had dreams of becoming doctors or engineers put on hold. Now some former teachers are offering education lifelines.

title.children: 'I want my children to become doctors': The push to get an education in a warzone

image.altText: A composite image of Mike Tyson and Jake Paul, both headshots, both men at indoor events

props.synopsis: The July fight between boxing great Mike Tyson and YouTuber-turned-prize fighter Jake Paul in Texas will be a sanctioned, professional fight that will count on both men's records.

title.children: Mike Tyson's return to the ring sanctioned as a professional fight against YouTube star Jake Paul

image.altText: A hammerhead shark entangled in a net below the surface of the ocean.

props.synopsis: There are renewed calls to halt a shark netting program as data reveals the toll the meshing is taking on endangered and "non-target" species.

title.children: More than 130 'non-target' animals have died in NSW shark nets in seven months, but meshing may continue

image.altText: Millions of dead fish floating on the Darling River at Menindee on a sunny day in March 2023.

props.synopsis: Scientists say rotting dead fish from a massive fish kill at Menindee earlier this year may create a domino effect on water quality as oxygen levels in the river plummet again putting more fish under stress.

title.children: Menindee continues to grapple with fish dying in the Darling River. Why does it keep happening here?

image.altText: A middle aged white woman with black glasses wearing a rainbow hoodie. She is sitting at a table making art

props.synopsis: Advocates say psychosocial disability is one of the most misunderstood and stigmatised areas of disability.

title.children: What is psychosocial disability and how is it different to a mental health condition?

image.altText: Olena Zelenska and Duchess Sophie stand together.

props.synopsis: Sophie, the Duchess of Edinburgh, visits Ukraine to meet with President Volodymyr Zelenskyy and his wife in the first trip to the country by a British royal since the conflict with Russia began, according to Buckingham Palace.

title.children: Duchess Sophie visits Ukraine in first trip by British royal since start of war

image.altText: Construction at a school in Tasmania.

props.synopsis: As work begins to find an unknown amount of old graves at a private boys' school built over an old cemetery, students and staff will be "protected from confronting scenes", the principal says.

title.children: Exhumation of old graves begins at Hobart private boys' school, amid measures to protect students from 'confronting scenes'

image.altText: Ninette Simons with severe facial bruising some days after the attack.

props.synopsis: A former detainee released after a landmark immigration High Court ruling is charged over a violent home invasion in Perth.

title.children: Former immigration detainee released in wake of High Court decision arrested after brutal home invasion

image.altText: A female parafencer has her epee raised in the air

props.synopsis: It's been over 50 years since a female parafencer has represented Australia at the Paralympics —  Stephenie Rodriguez is hoping to change this.

title.children: The parafencer hoping to break a 50-year drought

image.altText: An orange BHP logo on a grey background.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market is expected to open slightly higher as Wall Street investors await the US Federal Reserve's rates decision meeting this week. Mining giant BHP has reached a $US25.7 billion ($39.1 billion) settlement offer with the Brazilian government on the Samarco dam disaster. Follow the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX to edge up, BHP confirms $39b Samarco disaster settlement offer

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: CBA says there won't be a rate cut until November
Budget carrier Bonza cancels flights as its considers viability
BHP confirms $39 billion Samarco disaster settlement offer

image.altText: A man giving a dodgy look to the camera

props.synopsis: Solomon Islands' pro-China leader, Manasseh Sogavare, has withdrawn from the race to be the next prime minister following the country's national election.

title.children: Solomon Islands' pro-China leader Manasseh Sogavare withdraws from the race to be next prime minister

image.altText: A woman reacts as she tries to find her dog, following a wildfire at the village of Mati.

props.synopsis: An Athens court convicts six people and clears 15 others over the wildfires which killed more than 100 people at a Greek resort nearly six years ago.

title.children: Six convicted, 15 cleared over response to 2018 Greek resort wildfire which killed 104 people
